Articles.Content:
Through a sequence of links I can no longer remember, I came across something really neat: the [Atlas V Launch Services UserÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Guide](http://www.ulalaunch.com/uploads/docs/AtlasVUsersGuide2010.pdf). 400 pages of real rocket numbers. The most interesting thing so far, they have a launch configuration with a *single* SRB? Those engines must have a mean gimbal!

Hopefully this isn't a repost. Didn't see anything in a quick search.

Edit: LOLZ! In regards to the navigation system:

> 
> Both of these maneuvers are implemented through the launch-day wind-steering system, Automatic Determination and Dissemination of Just Upgraded Steering Terms (ADDJUST) which enhances launch availability by reducing wind-induced flight loads and engine deflections.

Someone has a sense of humor.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-08T16:23:01Z" title="08/08/2015 04:23  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 8, 2015</time> by ShakeNBake**
